intro: Jurinea mobayenii, commonly known as the desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Jurinea mobayenii is adapted to extreme temperatures and is an important component of its ecosystem.
